SEARCH
Package io.brane.core.abi

Class FastAbiEncoder

java.lang.Object
io.brane.core.abi.FastAbiEncoder
public final class FastAbiEncoder extends Object
High-performance ABI encoder that eliminates intermediate object allocations.

This encoder is designed for maximum throughput and low garbage collection pressure. It achieves this by:

  • Two-Pass Encoding: Calculating the exact buffer size required before writing, avoiding array resizing.
  • Zero-Copy: Writing primitive values and byte arrays directly to the output ByteBuffer.
  • Direct Padding: Applying zero-padding directly to the buffer without allocating temporary padding arrays.

Supported types:

  • UInt (uint8 - uint256)
  • Int (int8 - int256)
  • AddressType
  • Bool
  • Bytes (static and dynamic)
  • Utf8String
  • Array (static and dynamic)
  • Tuple

This class is thread-safe as it contains no mutable state.

    • encodeFunction

      public static byte[] encodeFunction(String signature, List<AbiType> args)
      Encodes a function call with its arguments.
      Parameters:
      signature - the function signature (e.g., "transfer(address,uint256)")
      args - the list of ABI typed arguments
      Returns:
      the encoded function call data including the 4-byte selector

    • encodeTuple

      public static void encodeTuple(List<AbiType> components, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Encodes a tuple of ABI types directly into the provided ByteBuffer.

      This method implements the standard ABI encoding for tuples: 1. Calculate the head size (sum of all static sizes, where dynamic types have a 32-byte head). 2. Pass 1 (Heads): Write static data for static types, or the current tail offset for dynamic types. 3. Pass 2 (Tails): Write the actual content of dynamic types.

      Parameters:
      components - the list of ABI types in the tuple
      buffer - the destination ByteBuffer

    • encodeUInt256

      public static void encodeUInt256(BigInteger value, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Encodes a uint256 value directly into the buffer. Optimized to use primitive long for values <= 63 bits to avoid BigInteger overhead.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to encode
      buffer - the destination buffer

    • encodeBytes

      public static void encodeBytes(HexData data, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Encodes dynamic bytes (HexData) directly into the buffer. Writes length (uint256) followed by data, right-padded to 32 bytes.
      Parameters:
      data - the HexData object
      buffer - the destination buffer

    • encodeBytes

      public static void encodeBytes(Bytes bytes, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Encodes dynamic bytes directly into the buffer. Writes length (uint256) followed by data, right-padded to 32 bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the bytes object
      buffer - the destination buffer

    • encodeString

      public static void encodeString(Utf8String string, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Encodes a UTF-8 string directly into the buffer. Writes length (uint256) followed by UTF-8 bytes, right-padded to 32 bytes.
      Parameters:
      string - the string object
      buffer - the destination buffer
